channel.title: My 64-bit Operating System
channel.description: Recent content on My 64-bit Operating System

item.title: Building Operating System
item.description: Building 64-bit Operating System Kernel from scratch. Tools used Visual Studio Code for writing and compiling the code Docker for building the Operating System Qemu for emulating the OS Building Image Using gcc compilation tools available on docker hub, environment is built and then a Docker Image is built from Windows against a non-Windows docker host and then an instance of that image is spinned up.

item.title: Printing Logo
item.description: Setting up Stack Setting up stack is crucial for linking OS with the C code for printing anything using C code. The purpose of stack is to store function call data i.e. the function variables and the memory address to which each function returns control upon completion. It is set up in the main assembly file. To do this, 16 kilobytes of memory is reserved when bootloader loads kernel. A stack pointer is also set to point to the starting stack frame.
